trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER</codeph> system procedure adds a new user account to a database.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER</codeph> system procedure adds a new user account to a database.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER</codeph> system procedure adds a new user account to a database.

trans-unit.source: This procedure creates users for use with NATIVE authentication. For details about NATIVE authentication, see derby.authentication.provider and "Using NATIVE authentication" in the .

seg-source.mrk: This procedure creates users for use with NATIVE authentication.
For details about NATIVE authentication, see derby.authentication.provider and "Using NATIVE authentication" in the .

target.mrk: This procedure creates users for use with NATIVE authentication.
For details about NATIVE authentication, see derby.authentication.provider and "Using NATIVE authentication" in the .

trans-unit.source: If NATIVE authentication is not already turned on when you call this procedure:

seg-source.mrk: If NATIVE authentication is not already turned on when you call this procedure:

target.mrk: If NATIVE authentication is not already turned on when you call this procedure:

trans-unit.source: The first user whose credentials are stored must be the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref>.

seg-source.mrk: The first user whose credentials are stored must be the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref>.

target.mrk: The first user whose credentials are stored must be the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref>.

trans-unit.source: Calling this procedure will turn on NATIVE authentication the next time the database is booted.

seg-source.mrk: Calling this procedure will turn on NATIVE authentication the next time the database is booted.

target.mrk: Calling this procedure will turn on NATIVE authentication the next time the database is booted.

trans-unit.source: Once you turn on NATIVE authentication with this procedure, it remains turned on permanently. There is no way to turn it off.

seg-source.mrk: Once you turn on NATIVE authentication with this procedure, it remains turned on permanently.
There is no way to turn it off.

target.mrk: Once you turn on NATIVE authentication with this procedure, it remains turned on permanently.
There is no way to turn it off.

trans-unit.source: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER(IN USERNAME VARCHAR(128), IN PASSWORD VARCHAR(32672))

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER(IN USERNAME VARCHAR(128), IN PASSWORD VARCHAR(32672))

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER(IN USERNAME VARCHAR(128), IN PASSWORD VARCHAR(32672))

trans-unit.source: No result set is returned by this procedure.

seg-source.mrk: No result set is returned by this procedure.

target.mrk: No result set is returned by this procedure.

trans-unit.source: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes. This user name is an authorization identifier. See "Authorization identifiers, user authentication, and user authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about how these names are treated.

seg-source.mrk: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes.
This user name is an authorization identifier.
See "Authorization identifiers, user authentication, and user authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about how these names are treated.

target.mrk: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes.
This user name is an authorization identifier.
See "Authorization identifiers, user authentication, and user authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about how these names are treated.

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Using NATIVE authentication," "Enabling user authentication," and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Using NATIVE authentication," "Enabling user authentication," and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

target.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Using NATIVE authentication," "Enabling user authentication," and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

trans-unit.source: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "fred"); cs.setString(2, "fredpassword"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

seg-source.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "fred"); cs.setString(2, "fredpassword"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

trans-unit.source: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER(?, ?)"); cs.setString(1, "\"FreD\""); cs.setString(2, "fredpassword"); cs.execute(); cs.close();
